heroSubTitle: Crowd Medicine .. Arbaeen Visit as a Model
iAgreeToTerms: I agree to the terms and conditions
aboutConferenceDes:
The International Medical Mobilization Conference is one of the most prominent annual events held in Karbala, organized by the Popular Mobilization Forces in collaboration with the Ministry of Health, Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research, and the Holy Al-Abbass Shrine. This conference was launched in response to the urgent need to develop health and service coordination during mass gatherings, especially during the Arbaeen pilgrimage, which witnesses the influx of millions of visitors from around the world.

The conference aims to enhance cooperation between health and service institutions to ensure the provision of the best healthcare services in exceptional circumstances. It also seeks to activate scientific research through the analysis of field and statistical data to raise health awareness among visitors and provide scientific solutions based on accurate studies.

Through this conference, the organizing entities strive to build a more efficient and responsive health system during the pilgrimage season, by exchanging experiences and knowledge between academic and medical personnel, which positively reflects on the safety and health of visitors.
conferenceTopicsDes: The topics of crowd medicine address the medical and administrative aspects of managing large gatherings, such as providing urgent healthcare, managing epidemics, and logistical needs during major events like the Arbaeen visit.

faqDec: Find answers to your questions below.
faq1_question: What is the date and location of the conference?
faq1_answer: The conference will be held on Friday and Saturday, August 9-10, 2024, corresponding to Safar 4-5, 1446, at Al-Sibtain University.
faq2_question: What are the main topics of the conference?
faq2_answer:
• Healthcare services (medical, nursing, pharmaceutical, and rehabilitation) during the Arbaeen visit and crowd medicine.
    • ...
faq3_question: How can I register for the conference?
faq3_answer: You can register by visiting the conference website, filling in your personal details, and submitting your research or participation. You can also submit via email at mgm@mgmarbaein.iq.
faq4_question: Who are the members of the scientific committee?
faq4_answer: First: Professors from the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research. Second: Doctors from the Ministry of Health. Third: Foreign doctors or expatriate Iraqi doctors.
faq5_question: Can I get the conference materials after it ends?
faq5_answer: Yes, conference materials will be available for participants after the event, including presentations, summaries, and any other useful resources.

formNote:
Notes
Please upload your submission in either doc or docx format.
Please download the authenticity declaration, sign it, and upload a copy in the information form. Bring the original with you when attending the conference. Upload the authenticity declaration in PDF format.
Use only the first and last pages of the PowerPoint for the conference; additional pages can be included as needed.
topicsDes1Des: Health services (medical, nursing, pharmaceutical, and rehabilitation) during the Arbaeen pilgrimage and crowd medicine.
topicsDes2Des: Public health, safety, and food security.
topicsDes3Des: Emergency medicine during mass gatherings, including injuries from terrorist and war-related events such as explosions and genocides in Gaza, and medical evacuation and rescue programs.
topicsDes4Des: Medical and health support programs for people with disabilities and chronic diseases.
topicsDes5Des: The role of media in health education.
topicsDes6Des: Mental health in crowd medicine and its connection to physical safety: interaction and influence.
topicsDes7Des: Technological advancements and their use in improving health service delivery to crowds.
topicsDes8Des: Mechanisms for coordinating the provision of all health services among organizing and supporting entities.

aboutdescription:
The International Scientific Medical Gathering Conference is considered one of the most prominent annual events held in the holy city of Karbala. It is organized by the Popular Mobilization Authority in cooperation with the Ministry of Health, the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research, and the Holy Shrine of Imam Hussein. The launch of this conference came in response to the urgent need to enhance coordination in health and service provision during mass pilgrimages, especially the Ziarat Al-Arbaeen, which witnesses the influx of millions of visitors from around the world.

The conference aims to strengthen cooperation between health and service institutions to ensure the best possible health services under exceptional circumstances. It also seeks to promote scientific research through the analysis of field and statistical data to raise health awareness among visitors and provide scientific solutions based on precise studies.

Through this conference, the organizing entities strive to build a more efficient and responsive health system during pilgrimage seasons by exchanging expertise and knowledge between academic and medical professionals, positively reflecting on the safety and well-being of the visitors.

iAgreeToTermsOutside_en:
- Accommodation is designated for researchers from all countries.
- If the research paper is submitted by multiple researchers, accommodation is limited to the primary researcher (the submitter).
- Accommodation begins on Thursday, July 31, 2025, after 12:00 PM, and ends on Sunday, August 3, 2025, before 12:00 PM.
- To ensure a suitable and focused academic environment for all participants, bringing children during the accommodation period or on conference days is prohibited.
insideParticipantsSubTitle: Participate in the Third International Conference by submitting your details and research papers
iAgreeToTermsInside_en:
- Accommodation is designated for researchers only, including participants from all governorates except neighboring ones (Babil and Najaf).
- If the research paper is submitted by multiple researchers, accommodation is limited to the primary researcher (the submitter).
- Accommodation begins on Thursday, July 31, 2025, after 12:00 PM, and ends on Sunday, August 3, 2025, before 12:00 PM.
- To ensure a suitable and focused academic environment for all participants, bringing children during the accommodation period or on conference days is prohibited.
